analytic.title: “Active Nature” and Other Striking Features of Abū Bishr Mattā ibn Yūnus’s Cosmology as Reconstructed from His Commentary on Aristotle’s Physics

monogr.title: Ideas in Motion in Baghdad and Beyond: Philosophical and Theological Exchanges between Christians and Muslims in the Third/Ninth and Fourth/Tenth Centuries

body.bibl: Janos, Damien. “‘Active Nature’ and Other Striking Features of Abū Bishr Mattā Ibn Yūnus’s Cosmology as Reconstructed from His Commentary on Aristotle’s Physics.” In Ideas in Motion in Baghdad and Beyond: Philosophical and Theological Exchanges between Christians and Muslims in the Third/Ninth and Fourth/Tenth Centuries, edited by Damien Janos, 135–77. Islamic History and Civilization 124. Leiden: Brill, 2015.

Damien Janos, Islamic History and Civilization 124 (Leiden: Brill, 2015), 135–77.
